instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with Battery Working USB-C DC in 20.1V 0.06A no power on
threads.message:
Dear All, 


The motherboard is working with battery (usb ports not working.) 
first when it is came one of the USB-C CD3217B integrated circuits was short-circuited, so I replaced it. Additionally, I programmed the U301 integrated circuit.

Currently, I'm getting a voltage reading of 20V 0.06A from all ports on the motherboard. When the battery is connected, it shows the voltage outwardly on a USB testing device. As I mentioned, the T2 is working because the device turns on and enters the system without any issues using the battery. Apart from that, <CAPACITOR>C7865</CAPACITOR> has a voltage of 3.3V, and the input side of the FET at the battery charging port shows 12.2V. The situation is the same for all ports. Does anyone have any ideas?

Thank you so much

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with Battery Working USB-C DC in 20.1V 0.06A no power on
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Do you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> with charger alone (no battery)?
What is U301?
Did you get <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chip from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> scrap board?
